techmeme.title: Google's 20% ad transaction cut was a primary subject of its antitrust trial at the end of week one; the DOJ says it's a key sign of Google's online ad monopoly (Lauren Feiner/The Verge)
Apple launches iOS 18 without Apple Intelligence, iPadOS 18, macOS 15 Sequoia, visionOS 2, and watchOS 11 (Gary Ng/iPhone in Canada Blog)
Amazon CEO Andy Jassy tells employees to return to the office five days a week, citing the importance of the policy to the company's culture (Annie Palmer/CNBC)
Apple Pay includes an option to pay with BNPL service Affirm on iOS 18, following the discontinuation of Apple Pay Later (Zac Hall/9to5Mac)
Review of macOS 15 Sequoia: features like window tiling, the Passwords app, and iPhone mirroring make it a solid update even without upcoming AI features (Andrew Cunningham/Ars Technica)
